email_group_1.subject: Updated Benefits Handbook Attached
email_group_1.desc: Hello team, as part of our annual policy review, we have released the updated Benefits Handbook outlining revisions to healthcare, leave, and reimbursement options. Please review the document at your earliest convenience to familiarize yourself with the upcoming changes. The updated version emphasizes flexible spending accounts, expanded dental coverage, and the new parental leave structure. Your acknowledgment is not required, but staying informed will help ensure a smooth benefits transition.
email_group_1.explain: HR update from internal address, proper formatting, legitimate content and filename.

email_group_1.subject: Important: HR Compliance Document Needed ASAP
email_group_1.desc: Dear employee, we detected that your HR compliance verification has expired. Please open the attached document immediately and confirm your data to avoid account deactivation. The document must be signed digitally within 24 hours to meet company regulations. Failure to comply could result in temporary account suspension.
email_group_1.explain: Uses urgency, suspicious misspelled domain, and malicious double extension file.

email_group_2.subject: Payroll Adjustment Confirmation
email_group_2.desc: Hello, this message confirms that your recent payroll adjustment for overtime hours in June has been processed successfully. The update will reflect in your next pay slip. No action is required on your part. For more details, you can log into your payroll portal.
email_group_2.explain: Legitimate payroll message; informational only, no links or attachments.

email_group_2.subject: Payroll Review Document Attached
email_group_2.desc: Dear user, we encountered discrepancies in your salary disbursement. Please download the attached file and confirm your payroll details immediately to avoid payment interruption. Once reviewed, send confirmation via reply email.
email_group_2.explain: Spoofed domain and malicious file; urgent tone requesting direct file execution.

email_group_3.subject: Team Offsite Logistics Update
email_group_3.desc: Hello all, the attached document includes updated travel schedules and hotel arrangements for our upcoming team offsite. Please check your flight timings, hotel confirmation numbers, and emergency contact details listed in the agenda. If you have dietary or travel concerns, contact operations by end of week.
email_group_3.explain: Internal logistics document; legitimate sender and valid attachment type.

email_group_3.subject: Urgent Travel Invoice Error
email_group_3.desc: Dear employee, your recent travel claim was flagged with errors. Please verify and resubmit immediately using the attached invoice file. Failure to act within 12 hours may lead to reimbursement delay.
email_group_3.explain: Fake urgency, lookalike domain with number substitution, and executable attachment.

email_group_4.subject: Quarterly Security Awareness Session
email_group_4.desc: As part of our continuous security training, you are invited to attend the upcoming awareness session this Friday at 2 PM. The meeting will cover multi-factor authentication best practices, password hygiene, and recognizing social engineering attacks.
email_group_4.explain: Official IT communication inviting to session; no suspicious links or files.

email_group_4.subject: Password Policy Violation Detected
email_group_4.desc: Your password policy compliance failed due to weak credential detection. Click the below link to reset immediately, or your account will be suspended. http://securemailling.com/reset-now
email_group_4.explain: Fake link to spoofed domain; uses fear tactics for password reset.

email_group_5.subject: Office Maintenance Schedule Update
email_group_5.desc: Facilities will conduct scheduled maintenance on all HVAC units this weekend. Please ensure personal items are cleared from your desk and that computers are powered down before leaving Friday. Maintenance will complete by Sunday evening.
email_group_5.explain: Routine maintenance announcement, standard tone, no threat indicators.

email_group_5.subject: Facility Report Form Required
email_group_5.desc: Hello employee, you must complete the attached facility report to maintain building access. Failure to return this file will block your ID card on Monday.
email_group_5.explain: Misspelled sender domain and dangerous executable attachment.

email_group_6.subject: Client Appreciation Webinar
email_group_6.desc: We’re excited to announce a new client engagement webinar next week. Join us as we showcase upcoming product launches, customer success stories, and networking opportunities. Please RSVP by Thursday.
email_group_6.explain: Promotional internal email, clear purpose, no risky content.

email_group_6.subject: Gift Voucher for Webinar Attendance
email_group_6.desc: Congratulations! You’ve won a $100 voucher for attending our webinar. Open the attached file for redemption instructions.
email_group_6.explain: Spoofed domain (1 instead of l) and suspicious reward attachment.

email_group_7.subject: VPN Access Renewal Notice
email_group_7.desc: Your VPN access token will renew automatically this Friday. No action is required unless you recently changed devices.
email_group_7.explain: Standard IT renewal notice, no clickable content.

email_group_7.subject: Immediate VPN Token Renewal Required
email_group_7.desc: Your VPN access will expire within 24 hours. Open the attached file and follow the instructions to reauthenticate your credentials.
email_group_7.explain: Spoofed domain, urgency, and malicious attachment.

email_group_8.subject: Internal Audit Reminder
email_group_8.desc: Reminder: The quarterly internal audit begins Monday. Please have all transaction records and reconciliations up to date by end of week.
email_group_8.explain: Legitimate reminder from audit; clear and procedural.

email_group_8.subject: Action Needed: Audit Reconciliation Document
email_group_8.desc: Dear team, we found discrepancies in your department’s Q2 statements. Kindly open the attached document and verify line items immediately.
email_group_8.explain: Uses lookalike domain with numeral substitution and malicious file.

email_group_9.subject: Performance Review Meeting
email_group_9.desc: This is your formal invitation for your annual performance review. The agenda is attached with talking points and self-assessment questions.
email_group_9.explain: Typical HR process email; valid attachment, normal tone.

email_group_9.subject: Performance Review Alert
email_group_9.desc: Due to an internal system issue, please open the attached file and re-upload your self-assessment before the HR deadline.
email_group_9.explain: Fake issue, urgent tone, lookalike domain substitution (l/I).

email_group_10.subject: Updated Cybersecurity Handbook
email_group_10.desc: The attached handbook outlines the new corporate cybersecurity framework and must-read sections on incident reporting and device management.
email_group_10.explain: Official communication, valid document, expected context.

email_group_10.subject: Mandatory Security Upgrade File
email_group_10.desc: Critical update! IT requires all employees to run the attached upgrade file to maintain security compliance. Execute immediately.
email_group_10.explain: Executable disguised as PDF; external domain; unrealistic IT procedure.

email_group_11.subject: Diversity and Inclusion Survey
email_group_11.desc: We invite you to complete our annual diversity survey to help us create a more inclusive workplace. Participation is anonymous and takes under five minutes.

email_group_11.subject: New Diversity Report File
email_group_11.desc: Kindly review the attached report and confirm receipt before 5 PM today.
email_group_11.explain: Fake urgency, suspicious attachment, numeric domain substitution.

email_group_12.subject: Expense Claim Update
email_group_12.desc: Your expense claim submitted on July 10th has been approved. Reimbursement will reflect in the next payroll cycle.
email_group_12.explain: Routine finance email, no attachments or urgent tone.

email_group_12.subject: Expense Review Required
email_group_12.desc: We noticed inconsistencies in your last claim. Please open the attached file and confirm your details.

email_group_13.subject: Team Event Photos
email_group_13.desc: Hi everyone, we’ve compiled photos from last week’s team outing in the attached PDF album. Enjoy and feel free to share!
email_group_13.explain: Friendly HR content; proper sender, safe file.

email_group_13.subject: Photo Access Alert
email_group_13.desc: To access your photos securely, download the attached encrypted file and log in using your company credentials.

email_group_14.subject: Office Parking Renewal Notice
email_group_14.desc: Your parking permit expires next month. Please renew online via the employee portal before the 25th to avoid disruptions.
email_group_14.explain: Standard facility notice; no attachments or urgency.

email_group_14.subject: Parking Violation Fee Notice
email_group_14.desc: A violation fee has been issued to your vehicle. Open the attached invoice immediately to settle and prevent escalation.
email_group_14.explain: Fake fine and external payment domain.

email_group_15.subject: Internal Knowledge Base Refresh
email_group_15.desc: We’ve reorganized the internal knowledge base for easier navigation. You can access it at the usual link via the intranet portal.
email_group_15.explain: Informational IT message, internal link, safe.

email_group_15.subject: Knowledge Portal Login Required
email_group_15.desc: Your portal access expired. Click the following link to revalidate: http://knowledgelink-support.com/login
email_group_15.explain: Fake support subdomain with credential-stealing link.

email_group_16.subject: New Company Newsletter
email_group_16.desc: This month’s newsletter highlights new sustainability goals, employee achievements, and upcoming events. The attached version includes visuals and extended interviews.
email_group_16.explain: Standard internal communication, safe attachment type.

email_group_16.subject: Company Update File
email_group_16.desc: Dear colleague, management requires all employees to open and acknowledge the attached update document today.
email_group_16.explain: Lookalike domain with capital I, false mandatory claim.

email_group_17.subject: Helpdesk Ticket Resolved
email_group_17.desc: Your reported printer issue (ticket #4872) has been resolved. Please reply if problems persist.
email_group_17.explain: Legitimate IT resolution message; references existing ticket.

email_group_17.subject: Ticket Closure Confirmation
email_group_17.desc: Please confirm closure by opening the attached ticket log. This action is mandatory to finalize the issue.
email_group_17.explain: Fake domain using uppercase 'I' substitution; dangerous file.

email_group_18.subject: Holiday Party RSVP
email_group_18.desc: We’re delighted to invite you to our annual holiday celebration! RSVP by Friday to help us plan catering and seating.
email_group_18.explain: Friendly internal event; safe and expected tone.

email_group_18.subject: Gift Card Program Enrollment
email_group_18.desc: As part of our celebration, claim your $100 Amazon card by opening the attached file and submitting your details.
email_group_18.explain: Spoofed domain and incentive scam with executable.
